nodes.name: Explain the origin of your idea.
nodes.title: # Explain the origin of your idea.
nodes.description: Clarifying your thinking and explaining the origins of your ideas. (Why do I think this? What exactly do I think?)

nodes.name: Challenging Assumption
nodes.description: How do I know this is true ? What if I thought the opposite ?
nodes.title: Challenging Assumption

nodes.name: Looking for evidences ?
nodes.description: How can I back this up ? What are the sources ?
nodes.title: Looking for evidences ?

nodes.name: Considering alternative perspectives
nodes.description:
Considering alternative perspectives. (What might others think? How do I know I am correct?)

Parrish, Shane; Beaubien, Rhiannon. The Great Mental Models Volume 1: General Thinking Concepts (p. 79). Latticework Publishing Inc.. Kindle Edition.
nodes.title: Considering alternative perspectives

nodes.name: Examining Consequences and implications
nodes.description:
Examining consequences and implications. (What if I am wrong? What are the consequences if I am?)

Parrish, Shane; Beaubien, Rhiannon. The Great Mental Models Volume 1: General Thinking Concepts (p. 79). Latticework Publishing Inc.. Kindle Edition.
nodes.title: # Three things
